response_text:
<![CDATA[CBC | Technology News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/technology/?cmp=rss en-ca Thu, 12 May 2016 16:02:23 EDT CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA[This organism is redefining our limb on the tree of life]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/mitochondria-eukaryote-1.3579238?cmp=rss 1.3579238 Thu, 12 May 2016 14:16:46 EDT Emily Chung News/Technology & Science

What separates animals, plants, fungi and even amoebas from bacteria? Well, there's one feature that no longer universally makes us distinct, thanks to a new study that redefines what it means to belong to our limb on the tree of life.

]]> <![CDATA[Why this winter's El Nino was one of the strongest on record]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/why-this-winter-s-el-nino-was-one-of-the-strongest-on-record-1.3578917?cmp=rss 1.3578917 Thu, 12 May 2016 16:02:23 EDT Torah Kachur News/Technology & Science

Two years ago, climatologists were predicting a strong El Nino. But it was actually this past winter that brought an unusually strong occurrence of the weather phenomenon. As CBC Radio science columnist Torah Kachur explains, the science behind El Nino is very complicated.

]]> <![CDATA[FBI refuses to disclose Firefox flaw it exploited, so it can't be fixed]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/mozilla-firefox-fbi-1.3579599?cmp=rss 1.3579599 Thu, 12 May 2016 15:18:52 EDT Reuters News/Technology & Science

Mozilla Corp has asked a federal judge to order the U.S. government to disclose a vulnerability in its Firefox web browser that the company says the FBI exploited to investigate users of a large and secretive child pornography website.

]]> <![CDATA[Hey, Quebec scientists, want to measure a fish? That'll be $320]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/wildlife-ministry-lessard-permit-fees-1.3578721?cmp=rss 1.3578721 Thu, 12 May 2016 15:00:00 EDT Steve Rukavina News/Canada/Montreal

Quebec's Wildlife Ministry has quietly introduced new fees that will force researchers — including volunteers, teachers and students — to pay to examine wildlife in their natural habitats.

]]> <![CDATA[Hyperloop One test impresses backers as inventors look for 'Kitty Hawk moment']]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/hyperloop-one-test-nevada-1.3577990?cmp=rss 1.3577990 Wed, 11 May 2016 23:35:50 EDT Kim Brunhuber News/Technology & Science

Hyperloop was put to the test for the first time in Las Vegas desert. Investors say they're happy with what they saw.

]]> <![CDATA[India suffering under its worst drought in decades]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/photos/india-suffering-under-its-worst-drought-in-decades-1.3579336?cmp=rss 1.3579336 Thu, 12 May 2016 13:53:10 EDT News/World/World Photos

More than 330 million people — almost a quarter of India's population — have been hit by water shortages linked to the country’s worst drought in decades, and government mismanagement is being blamed for making the situation worse.

]]> <![CDATA[Scientists map biodiversity of deep oceans, find surprising varieties of life]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/deep-sea-biodiversity-life-1.3578720?cmp=rss 1.3578720 Thu, 12 May 2016 10:38:14 EDT Michael Tutton News/Canada/Nova Scotia

A humble star-shaped creature that crawls across the floors of the seabed has helped a group of scientists come up with a map predicting surprising amounts of life in some of the world's deepest, darkest oceans.

]]> <![CDATA[Worst polluted cities likely don't monitor air quality well: WHO]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/health/air-pollution-cities-ranked-1.3578799?cmp=rss 1.3578799 Thu, 12 May 2016 10:04:08 EDT Reuters News/Health

India has four of the 10 cities in the world with the worst air pollution, the World Health Organization says.

]]> <![CDATA[As climate change claims heat up, insurance industry says we need to adapt: Don Pittis]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/fort-mac-climate-insurance-1.3576918?cmp=rss 1.3576918 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:00 EDT Don Pittis News/Business

More than 40 years ago, the insurance industry was a leader in warning about the impact of climate change. But as the number of weather-related disasters soars, experts say the business must focus on adapting to climate change, rather than preventing it.

]]> <![CDATA[Google bans ads from payday lenders, calling them 'harmful']]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/google-payday-lenders-1.3578716?cmp=rss 1.3578716 Thu, 12 May 2016 08:52:43 EDT The Associated Press News/Technology & Science

Google says will ban all ads from payday lenders, calling the industry "deceptive" and "harmful."

]]> <![CDATA[Saskatoon 3D printer startup accuses his partner of using crowdsourcing funds to build a house]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatoon/peachy-printer-3d-saskatoon-alleged-theft-kickstarter-1.3577267?cmp=rss 1.3577267 Wed, 11 May 2016 19:05:23 EDT Jennifer Quesnel News/Canada/Saskatoon

The Saskatoon founder of a 3D printer startup that raised more than $725,000 through crowdfunding says his company is out of money, and accused his former business partner of using more than $320,000 of the funding to build himself a house.

]]> <![CDATA[Tech employees in China work, eat and sleep at the office]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/multimedia/tech-employees-in-china-work-eat-and-sleep-at-the-office-1.3577352?cmp=rss 1.3577352 Wed, 11 May 2016 16:26:19 EDT Reuters News/Multimedia

China's technology sector is booming and many startup firms can't hire staff fast enough, forcing workers to burn the midnight oil to meet deadlines.

]]> <![CDATA[135 new research jobs in Fisheries and Oceans Canada hiring blitz]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/fisherie-oceans-department-hiring-research-scientists-1.3577115?cmp=rss 1.3577115 Wed, 11 May 2016 12:25:44 EDT Marilyn Boone News/Canada/NL

Fisheries and Oceans Canada says it will hire 135 research scientists, biologists, oceanographers and technicians in its largest single recruitment toward restoring ocean science.

]]> <![CDATA[Solar Impulse 2 continues global voyage by heading to Oklahoma]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/solar-impulse-2-oklahoma-1.3578598?cmp=rss 1.3578598 Thu, 12 May 2016 06:31:28 EDT The Associated Press News/Technology & Science

A solar-powered airplane that landed in Arizona last week is headed to Oklahoma on the latest leg of its around-the-world journey.

]]> <![CDATA[Ultra-fast hyperloop transportation technology tested successfully]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/hyperloop-one-test-1.3577182?cmp=rss 1.3577182 Wed, 11 May 2016 13:08:28 EDT Reuters News/Technology & Science

Hyperloop One, a Los Angeles company working to develop futuristic transportation technology, conducted a successful test of its high speed transportation technology Wednesday in the desert outside Las Vegas

]]>
